messages.page_content: Apologies, but the provided content is not an ordinance summary. It appears to be a set of guidelines and instructions for creating an ordinance summary. If you have specific ordinances from the meeting that you would like to be summarized, please provide the details, and I would be happy to assist you in creating the summaries.
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 12-15-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Military Appreciation Day Presentation
- Summary: Major General David Mize presented Military Appreciation Day in the City of New Orleans, celebrating the military and acknowledging its service to the country.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:

- Decision/Key Actions: Presentation made by Major General David Mize

- Topic: Roll Call and Approval of Meeting Minutes

- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Approved - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)

messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 12-15-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Billing Dispute and Appeals Procedures for Sewerage and Water Board of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain Chapter 159, Sections 159-2 and 159-3, and ordain Sections 159-4 and 159-5 to establish the billing dispute and appeals procedures for the Sewerage and Water Board of New Orleans. It was electronically submitted and recommended for approval by the SWBNO Billing Advisory Committee. An amendment was also proposed by Councilmembers Morrell and Giarrusso.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,937
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopted, as amended - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with amendments.
- UID: 4795eaf4-8353-4fc4-8719-b47b6ebee1ba

- Topic: Amendment to Ordinance Calendar No. 33,937
- Summary: This amendment proposed several changes to the original ordinance, including specific adjustments to wording, billing procedures, and customer rights during the dispute process.
- Ordinance Number: Amendment to Ordinance Calendar No. 33,937
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment was proposed by Councilmembers Morrell and Giarrusso.
- UID: 4795eaf4-8353-4fc4-8719-b47b6ebee1ba
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 12-15-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Ordinance Calendar No. 33,937
- Summary: This substitute amendment proposed changes to the billing process for water usage, including adjustments to billing cycles, dispute resolution, and customer payment during the dispute process.
- Ordinance Number: 33,937
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The substitute amendment to Ordinance Calendar No. 33,937 was passed with a vote of 7 YEAS.
- Tags/Keywords: Substitute Amendment, Billing Process, Water Usage, Dispute Resolution
- UID: cc99e050-35c3-444c-88a7-d72a9b37fd36
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 12-15-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Customer Billing Ordinance
- Summary: The ordinance proposed several amendments to the customer billing process, including changes to notification timelines, appeals processes, and inspection rights. The council discussed and voted on these amendments, leading to specific changes in the ordinance.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
  - Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
  - Vote 2: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendments to the ordinance were passed, with specific changes detailed in the meeting minutes. 
- Tags/Keywords: Customer Billing, Ordinance Amendments, Notification, Appeals Process
- UID: d89a34e6-c811-428c-8c73-de036f868570
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 12-15-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Section 70-10 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance establishes reporting requirements for the Department of Finance, including the issuance of a statement alongside each payment to a security and improvement district, and an annual financial report to be transmitted to the City Council.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,893
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed as amended.
- Tags/Keywords: Reporting requirements, Department of Finance, financial report
- UID: 22790252-1641-48bd-afa7-d1d99851a324

- Topic: Rules governing the review and approval of contracts
- Summary: The motion creates rules (Rule 57 — Contract Approval) governing the review and approval of contracts.
- Ordinance Number: NO. M-22-537
- Votes Summary:

- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was passed.
- Tags/Keywords: Contract approval, Rule 57
- UID: 22790252-1641-48bd-afa7-d1d99851a324

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Sections 2-476 and 2-477 of the Code of the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to require the Chief Administrative Office to maintain a current organizational charter for the Executive Branch and to report appointments for positions subject to Council confirmation. 
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,975
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without amendments.

messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 12-15-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Repealing and superseding Rule 56 (Temporary COVID-19 Meeting Procedures) with Rule 56 (Confirmation of Executive Branch Appointments)
- Summary: Motion M-22-507, introduced by Councilmember Morrell, aimed to replace the current Rule 56 with a new one focused on the confirmation of executive branch appointments. An amendment was made to include specific procedures for the approval or disapproval of appointments and the extension of interim appointments.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-507
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion was adopted and amended to include specific procedures for appointment confirmation and extension.
- Tags/Keywords: Rule 56, Executive Branch Appointments, Confirmation
- UID: 0fc4dbf5-7ea4-41df-89ca-590e600bf53e
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 12-15-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Section 26-236 regarding blight and public nuisance definitions
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish additional definitions for what may be declared a blight and public nuisance. It was introduced by Councilmember Morrell and was continued to the meeting of 1/5/23.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,983
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
    - Vote 2: Adopt - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
    - Vote 3: As Amended - Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed with amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Blight, Public Nuisance, Definitions, Amendment
- UID: cffc74d4-ed2a-4980-8328-b37bc5ab7ba3
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 12-15-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Creation of City of New Orleans Home Rule Charter Review Committee
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the creation of an advisory committee, known as the City of New Orleans Home Rule Charter Review Committee, to review and make non-binding recommendations to the New Orleans City Council regarding potential changes to the Home Rule Charter.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-516
- Votes Summary:
    - Motion: Lying Over
        - Vote: N/A
    - Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 1/5/23
- UID: 7a1b1a11-5fb9-4f87-b2e2-861cd371d89e

- Topic: Review of Existing City Contracts for Compliance
- Summary: The resolution directs the City Attorney, Chief Administrative Officer, and Director of Purchasing to review existing City contracts for compliance with City Code, CAO policy, and all other applicable requirements for procurement and issuance of contracts. The City Attorney is directed to take appropriate steps to annul and reprocure any agreement that has exceeded the term of the original bid or is not otherwise in compliance with applicable mandates.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-521
- Votes Summary:
    - Amendment: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
    - As Amended: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The resolution passed as amended.
- UID: 7a1b1a11-5fb9-4f87-b2e2-861cd371d89e

- Topic: Zoning Change in Historic Urban Neighborhood
- Summary: The ordinance aims to change the zoning from a Historic Urban Two-Family Residential District to a Historic Urban Neighborhood Business District in a specific area. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 77/22
- Votes Summary:

- Decision/Key Actions: The zoning change was approved.

- Summary: This ordinance seeks to amend the city code to increase the maximum airport shuttle fares. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 162-842
- Votes Summary:

- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment to increase airport shuttle fares was approved.

- Topic: Approval of Implementation Plans for Entergy New Orleans
- Summary: This resolution approves the implementation plans for the 2021 Triennial Integrated Resource Plan of Entergy New Orleans, Inc., specifically for Energy Smart Program years 13 through 14, with reserved approval of Energy Smart Program year 15. The resolution was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: UD-20-02
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (Unanimous)
- Decision/Key Actions: The implementation plans for the Energy Smart Program were approved.
- UID: 888d49e6-2e3a-4150-94c1-239b8f324084
